text:
Apache+mod_proxy+mod_proxy_http on FreeBSD 6.2.
Both 2.0.59 and 2.0.61

Config is simplest and has no changes after install except:

|LoadModule proxy...
|LoadModule http_proxy...
|...
|ProxyRequests On
|<Proxy *>
|	Order allow,deny
|	Allow from all
|</Proxy>
 
Url "error.livejournal.com" - it work fine.
Url "error_.livejournal.com" or "_error.livejournal.com" - it returns code 502
with reason "DNS lookup failure".

The problem is sing "_".

Actually server returns code 302.

Same version on Windows2K works fine.
creator: dymm2000@gmail.com
dymm2000@gmail.com
text:
Version 1.3 on OpenBSD 3.9 works correct

Both OpenBSD and FreeBSD run on VirtualPC
That's not "URL with an underscore", it's an illegal hostname (see RFC2396).
creator: nick@webthing.com
dymm2000@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> That's not "URL with an underscore", it's an illegal hostname (see RFC2396).

Thanks. You are right.

Why the same version works different on windows system (also 1.3)?

In this case Apache sends DNS request and DNS server returns code 302 with new
correct host like "users.livejournal.com/error_"
